HDG.BC.content: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”

HDG.BC.content: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: place of man w/in beings (being that calculates, gift of reason), organism that deifies “reason” (1st happened in French Revolution) > “life” not, for man, object standing opposite him: life is what life itself accomplishes, enjoys, survives, what it guides through itself, carries by its own stream [river, Heraclitus], life is (as taught since 19th Century) “lived experience (Erlebnis)” > life veritably “overflows” w/ “lived experiences”

HDG.WM.content: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: presumed soberness of mind, superiority of science: laughable when doesn’t take nothing seriously > it’s only because nothing is manifest that science can make beings themselves objects of investigation > new task of science (its essential task) to exist on basis of metaphysics, disclose entire expanse of truth in nature & history [?]

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: origin of dichotomy [subject/object]: mutation of truth into certainty, priority given to man as ego cogito, rise to position (Stellung) of subject > nature becomes object (ob-jectum), nothing other than “what is thrown over against me (das mir Entgegengeworfene)”

HDG.FS.content: Kant’s Vorstellung (representation): 1) particular representation (intuition), this book 2) representation in general, the book as such (object as object)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kant’s Vorstellung (representation): 1) particular representation (intuition), this book 2) representation in general, the book as such (object as object)

HDG.FS.content: “what is proper to all colors?” not Husserl’s question, who sought to clarify constitution of object in consciousness, phenomenologizes Kantian analysis of anticipations of perception
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “what is proper to all colors?” not Husserl’s question, who sought to clarify constitution of object in consciousness, phenomenologizes Kantian analysis of anticipations of perception

HDG.FS.content: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflection,” Latin re-flexere, turning-back upon itself (zurückzuwenden), towards the ego > in Descartes, ego, as cogitans, appears as cogitatum, object > in Kant’s language: “it must be possible for the I think to accompany all my representations” > transcendental apperception re: finite essence of man > Hegel absolutizes finite understanding, brings power of conjoining to absolute power: “what is finite w/ man becomes the infinite Absolute” > infinite as sublation of finite

HDG.FS.content: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: what sort of positing is that by which Absolute appears for consciousness? > in Greek, positing is thesis, apothēkē means same as apophansis, let matter stand here from itself, as it is, i.e. presences (anwest) > modern positing, however, is closest to Latin repraesentatio, the re- refers back to ego cogito, re- as “back to me,” thus that which stands becomes object (all this covered over by presumptions of idealism)

HDG.FS.content: for Greeks, phenomenon is the thing in itself (an abyss btwn Aristotle & Kant) > unity of ta onta and ta phainomena impossible for Kant > the being has become an ob-ject (res obstans), expression “object” has no correlate in Geek
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Greeks, phenomenon is the thing in itself (an abyss btwn Aristotle & Kant) > unity of ta onta and ta phainomena impossible for Kant > the being has become an ob-ject (res obstans), expression “object” has no correlate in Geek

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”

HDG.FS.content: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through
HDG.FS.linkedContent: more disturbing than space conquest, transformation of biology into biophysics: human can be produced acc. definite plan like any technological object > science can’t stop in time, can’t limit human desire for knowledge > reason for this event: modern relation to power (political), new form of nationalism must be thought through

HDG.FS.content: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: as technology unfolds objectivity (Gegenständlichkeit) (as a manner of sending) transforms more into standing reservedness (Beständlichkeit) > no longer objects today only standing reserves (beings held in readiness for being consumed [Verbrauchtwerden]), no longer substances but subsistances > energy politics, politics of agriculture: systematic ordering of space w/in general planning, directed toward future exploitation (Ausbeutung), everything arranged in horizon of utility: orderability (Bestellbarkeit) [better than Beherrschung] of what is to be seized > for example: forest as “greenspace” (stock, supply, means)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, “categorial intuition” focal point of Husserlian thought > ground of sensuous what Husserl calls hyle, that which affects sensibly, the sense data (blue, black, spatial extension) > along w/ sense data comes the object: object can’t be perceived sensibly (fact that object is object doesn’t arise from sensuous intuition)

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness
HDG.FS.linkedContent: subjectivity itself not questioned re: its being > since Descartes, subjectivity is fundamentum inconcussum, the barrier to unfolding Seinsfrage ——the “making-present-to-oneself (Selbstvergegenwärtigung)” of consciousness takes place in immanence, what I am conscious of is present to me, in my consciousness > in Being and Time, “thing” no longer in consciousness, but in the world > despite intentionality, Husserl remains trapped in immanence: Husserl retrieves proper consistency of object, saves object, but by situating it in immanence of consciousness

HDG.FS.content: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: can man bring about all these imperatives & could he break them himself? Marxism & sociology name the “imperatives”—to which we are compelled today > Heidegger gathers then in name Ge-stell, most extreme form of history of metaphysics, of the destiny of being, from epoch of objectivity to orderability, no longer objects only “consumer goods” at disposal of every consumer [w/out objectivity, is there no more consciousness?]

HDG.FS.content: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])
HDG.FS.linkedContent: scholastic word objectum is translation of Greek word antikeimenon, but keisthai of antikeimenon means already lying before > whereas object, via representation, brought to halt in an “over and against (im Gegenüber)” > Greek experience of already lying before (and from itself) doesn’t require representation play role in positing being > Aristotle interprets phusis from poiēsis, bringing-forth into open—not modern notion of production (set into availability [Herstellen in die Verfügbarkeit])

HDG.CCP.content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

HDG.CCP.content: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: things appearing in Gegnet no longer objects, no longer stand opposite us, no longer stand at all > they lie, “rest in the return to the aiding of the expanse of their self-belonging” > there can be rest where rest is the seat/reign of all movement > we can’t really describe what he have named > non, any description would reify it > but, it lets itself be named & thus we can think about it (not representationally) > perhaps we are close to being released into nature of thinking…through waiting for its nature [arrival?]

HDG.CCP.content: objects, things-in-themselves: such terminology freezes thought > “after that scholarly reservation, you shouldn’t hesitate to speak in a scholarly manner”
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: objects, things-in-themselves: such terminology freezes thought > “after that scholarly reservation, you shouldn’t hesitate to speak in a scholarly manner”

HDG.CCP.content: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: thing: object = human: ego [ontic/metaphysics had to emerge historically so we could return]

HDG.DL.content: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other
HDG.DL.linkedContent: the call of two-fold can’t be explained by presence or present beings, nor in terms of their relation > only two-fold itself which unfolds (enfaltet) the clarity, the clearing (Lichtung), in which Anwesende als solches and Anwesen can be discerned (unterscheidbar) for man > no longer say relation to two-fold, not an object of mental representation, but: the sway of usage (das Walten des Brauches), which we never experience (erfahren) directly [!] [arrival?] if we think (vorstellen) two-fold as difference (Unterschied) visible in comparison that tries to hold Anwesende and Anwesen apart from each other

HDG.DL.content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

HDG.DL.content: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [in metaphysical aesthetics] art work an object for our feelings/ideas, artist the subject related to his work as object: a treacherous framework (verfänglich), can capture (einfangen) all other kinds of experience of art & its nature > Iki is the gracious (Anmutende)

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language
HDG.DL.linkedContent: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.LP.content: to sing: to praise/guard the object of praise in song
HDG.LP.linkedContent: to sing: to praise/guard the object of praise in song

HDG.LP.content: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Trakl’s poetry doesn’t need historical objects because historical in highest sense: sings of the destiny of casts/blows (Geschick des Schlages), that which casts Menschengeschlecht away (verschlägt) in its still withheld nature [?]—i.e. saves mankind

HDG.OHF.content: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [Heidegger on modern forms of ontology vis phenomenology] only through phenomenology that ontology corresponding to it established on secure basis (sichere Problembasis): only in this manner that the consciousness-of-, the “of which (Wovon),” the object character of a being (der Gegenstandscharakter des Seienden) as such, becomes visible (sichtbar) > wide sense of phenomenology includes ontology > but, in such ontology, meaning of being (Seinssinn) never posed, unknown to it, genesis of meaning remains closed off to it > which field of Being is never asked

HDG.OHF.content: “Facticity (Faktizität),” designation (Bezeichnung) for the Seinscharakter of “our” “own” Dasein: “this” Dasein in its Jeweiligkeit, Verweilen [see TN endnote p. 102 for extensive explanation of neologism here], “its being-there for awhile at the particular time,” insofar as it is “there” in the manner of be-ing > Dasein is there for itself in the how (Wie) of its ownmost being (seines eigensten Seins) > “Being—transitive: to be factical life!” > Being not the possible object of a having (Habens) [dispossession]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “Facticity (Faktizität),” designation (Bezeichnung) for the Seinscharakter of “our” “own” Dasein: “this” Dasein in its Jeweiligkeit, Verweilen [see TN endnote p. 102 for extensive explanation of neologism here], “its being-there for awhile at the particular time,” insofar as it is “there” in the manner of be-ing > Dasein is there for itself in the how (Wie) of its ownmost being (seines eigensten Seins) > “Being—transitive: to be factical life!” > Being not the possible object of a having (Habens) [dispossession]

HDG.OHF.content: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: hermenutics: wakefulness (Wachsein) of Dasein for itself (not conventional understanding) > interpreting is a being, a distinctive how of character of being of facticity, that belongs to factical life itself (facticity not the object of hermeneutics) > chance that hermeneutics will go wrong belongs to its ownmost being

HDG.OHF.content: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)

HDG.OHF.content: system as a context of classification (sketch out framework then allocate respective places for concrete beings) > the relational becomes the object proper, pushes to the fore: dominating/pervading everything, it constitutes being in authentic sense > the classificatory is immutable (Unwandelbare), elevated above what it organizes/rules, the trans-temporal in-itself (das überzeitliche Ansich) (being, validity [Gelten], value, subsistence [Bestehen]—contrasts sensible reality)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: system as a context of classification (sketch out framework then allocate respective places for concrete beings) > the relational becomes the object proper, pushes to the fore: dominating/pervading everything, it constitutes being in authentic sense > the classificatory is immutable (Unwandelbare), elevated above what it organizes/rules, the trans-temporal in-itself (das überzeitliche Ansich) (being, validity [Gelten], value, subsistence [Bestehen]—contrasts sensible reality)

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”

HDG.OHF.content: Dasein: not an object, when, as a distinctive being, it’s there for itself authentically
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Dasein: not an object, when, as a distinctive being, it’s there for itself authentically

HDG.OHF.content: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] to discover the as what encountered via todayness of historical consciousness & philosophy, we follow a path of analysis “in which we look to their particular modes of being-related (Weise des Bezogenseins) to their object”

HDG.OHF.content: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: object of the past (Vergangenheit), in historical consciousness, stands in fundamental definition (Grundbestimmung): Ausdrucksein eines etwas von etwas > the past’s being subjected to a known definition, temporally particular styles > Vor-sicht (fore-sight) [not forehaving?] having the style in view

HDG.OHF.content: expressive network of reference to different cultural systems demands possibility of holding onto them in a unified manner (einer einheitlichen Behaltbarkeit) > thus, investigations are actualizing (vollzieht) themselves out of a foresight re: and of a having-in-view of styles (Vorsicht auf- und einem Im-Blick-haben des Stils) > w/in this point of view (Hinblick) the modes of expressive being are actualized > the anticipatory having-present of the cultural object, running in advance of all research, made explicit in its actualization: das Vorweghaben der Stileinheitlichkeit (the anticipatory forehaving or path-having in advance of unity of style) proves/guards (bewährt) its adequacy to subject matter while explaining itself (its basic characteristics still hidden) [self-fulfilling w/out an eye to destruction]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: expressive network of reference to different cultural systems demands possibility of holding onto them in a unified manner (einer einheitlichen Behaltbarkeit) > thus, investigations are actualizing (vollzieht) themselves out of a foresight re: and of a having-in-view of styles (Vorsicht auf- und einem Im-Blick-haben des Stils) > w/in this point of view (Hinblick) the modes of expressive being are actualized > the anticipatory having-present of the cultural object, running in advance of all research, made explicit in its actualization: das Vorweghaben der Stileinheitlichkeit (the anticipatory forehaving or path-having in advance of unity of style) proves/guards (bewährt) its adequacy to subject matter while explaining itself (its basic characteristics still hidden) [self-fulfilling w/out an eye to destruction]

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: philosophy as universal classification (Ordnen), encompasses (umspannt) totality of culture (Gesamtheit der Kultur), the system of cultural systems > this totality not examined as theme in philosophy > temporal itself not investigated, but rather is that from out of which (von dem aus) classifying takes its point of departure (das Ordnen seinen Ausgang nimmt), so to insert it into context of classification > the comporting at point of departure (Ausgangsverhalten) of classifying grasps temporal in advance as types, essential generalities, only in this way can it enter a context of classification, so it doesn’t define or tarry in transitional stage, the one relevant for its actualizing > no one is disturbed by this, they characterize the point of departure as an object (temporal, empirical, mutable, subjective, real, singular, individual), in contrast to trans-temporal, ideal, universal

HDG.OHF.content: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: categories are haphazardly employed (from disparate sources) to characterize the basis (Boden) from out of which classifying begins to run its course (seinen Gang nimmt) > “that the Ausgangsverhalten is unworried (Unbekümmertheit) [since worry is there in opening to phenomenological hermeneutics] about its own concrete and precise clarification when the classifying and filing away is being done” “is only a symptom of the fact that its objects are ‘only’ material for a typology and system of classification” > idea of knowledge pursued (angestrebte) here, already sketched out in advance (schon vorgezeichnet) [goes on to describe static system, structuralism even]

HDG.OHF.content: [history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [history of phenomenology] phenomenon, distinctive mode of being an object (shows itself, not merely represented): being-present as an object from out of itself (das von ihm selbst her Präsentsein eines Gegenstandes) > certain modes of the object that aren’t genuine can still be factically dominant

HDG.OHF.content: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [bracketing of phenomenology—deconstruction of Heidegger’s destruction?] Husserl’s phenomenology: “where are the objects about which logic speaks and how are they for it?” > Brentano characterized consciousness as intentionality, a concept that arose in Middle Ages, though it had narrower meaning then: volitional being-out-for-something and going-toward-it (das willentliche Aussein auf etwas) (orexis)

HDG.OHF.content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”

HDG.OHF.content: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: to bring mathematics to play as model (Vorbildes) for all scientific disciplines is unphenomenological: meaning of rigor must be drawn from kind of object being questioned & mode of access appropriate to it (angemessenen Zugangsart) [Heidegger beyond Husserl]

HDG.OHF.content: phenomenology needs to be understood in accord w/ its possibility, possibility means: taking it up (ergreifen) in its being & developing (ausbilden) it (what’s sketched out in advance [vorgezeichnet] re: its possibilities)> in phenomenology, objects encountered by a definite manner of looking toward them and seeing them (bestimmtes Hinsehen), one does so already oriented toward them, an already-being-familiar (schon Bekanntsein), the sedimented result (Niederschlag) of having heard about them
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: phenomenology needs to be understood in accord w/ its possibility, possibility means: taking it up (ergreifen) in its being & developing (ausbilden) it (what’s sketched out in advance [vorgezeichnet] re: its possibilities)> in phenomenology, objects encountered by a definite manner of looking toward them and seeing them (bestimmtes Hinsehen), one does so already oriented toward them, an already-being-familiar (schon Bekanntsein), the sedimented result (Niederschlag) of having heard about them

HDG.OHF.content: [method] to hit upon object in primordial manner: 1) provide/sketch in advance character of being of object of philosophy 2) provide/sketch character of way it becomes object for us 3) right way to gain access to it & bring it to true safekeeping
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method] to hit upon object in primordial manner: 1) provide/sketch in advance character of being of object of philosophy 2) provide/sketch character of way it becomes object for us 3) right way to gain access to it & bring it to true safekeeping

HDG.OHF.content: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “phenomenon” will become truly earnest matter if it turns that to be in mode of covering-up-itself (Sich-verdeckens) & self-veiling (Sich-verschleierns) [which constitutes object of philosophy] belongs to Seinscharakter des Seins [withdrawal of Being]: phenomenology in radical sense

HDG.OHF.content: the path hermeneutics of facticity attempts to travel (versucht zu gehen), the forehaving (Vorhabe), interpretively explicated, must be put into context of object (Gegenstandzusammenhang) & seen there (hineingesehen)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: the path hermeneutics of facticity attempts to travel (versucht zu gehen), the forehaving (Vorhabe), interpretively explicated, must be put into context of object (Gegenstandzusammenhang) & seen there (hineingesehen)

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
